## Study population

Insert here study population. Most likely a flowchart is necessary for describing eligibility of patients and for reproducibility.

```{r, results='hide', echo=F, fig.height=8, fig.width=8}
library(Gmisc)
library(grid)

grid.newpage()

N0 <- 100
N1 <- 75

x_coord1 <- 0.3

text_box1 <- paste0("Population 1\nN=", N0)
box1 <- boxGrob(text_box1, x=x_coord1, y=0.9, bjust = "center")
box1

text_box2 <- paste0("Population 2\nN=", N1)
box2 <- boxGrob(text_box2, x=x_coord1, y=0.1, bjust = "center")
box2

excluded1 <- boxGrob(paste0("Exclusion (n=", N0-N1, ")"), x = x_coord1+0.27, y = (coords(box2)$top + coords(box1)$bottom)/2, just="left", bjust = "left")
excluded1

connectGrob(box1, box2, "vertical")
connectGrob(box1, excluded1, "-")
```

## Results

### Interactive descriptive tables

```{r, echo=T}
set.seed(1)
n <- 1000

a <- rnorm(n, mean=40, sd=20)
b <- rpois(n, lambda=3)
c <- rpois(n, lambda=1.5)

data <- data.frame(age=a, num_coffee=b, quarto=c)

library(tidyverse)
data_agg <- data %>% group_by(quarto) %>% summarise(mean_age=round(mean(age),1), sum_coffee=sum(num_coffee))

library(DT)
# Build factors for filtering in datatable()
data_agg$sum_coffee <- factor(data_agg$sum_coffee)
data_agg$quarto <- factor(data_agg$quarto)

col_names_table <- c("Intensity of Quarto use", "Mean age", "Sum of coffees")
datatable(data_agg, colnames=col_names_table, rownames = F, filter = 'top', options = list(pageLength = 20))
```

### Interactive graphs

```{r, echo=T}
library(plotly)

fig <- ggplot(data_agg, aes(x=quarto, y=sum_coffee))+geom_point()+
  ylab("Intensity of Quarto use")+xlab("Sum of coffees")+theme_bw()
ggplotly(fig)
```
